Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: During hypotension produced by SNP similar decreases were observed in mean pulmonary arterial pressure ( p less than 0 . 01 ) , central venous pressure ( p less than 0 . 001 ) , left ventricular end - diastolic pressure ( p less than 0 . 01 ) , total peripheral resistance ( p less than 0 . 001 ) , rate pressure product ( p less than 0 . 001 ) , and oxygen content difference between arterial and mixed venous blood ( p less than 0 . 05 ) , while heart rate ( p less than 0 . 001 ) and cardiac output ( p less than 0 . 05 ) were increased .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Hypotension |
| SNP |
| Pulmonary arterial pressure |
| Central venous pressure |
| Left ventricular end-diastolic pressure |
| Total peripheral resistance |
| Rate pressure product |
| Oxygen content difference between arterial and mixed venous blood |
| Heart rate |
| Cardiac output |

Note:

* "Hypotension" and "SNP" are not actually diseases, but they are mentioned in the context of the paragraph as entities related to the study being described.
* "Pulmonary arterial pressure," "central venous pressure," "left ventricular end-diastolic pressure," "total peripheral resistance," "rate pressure product," and "oxygen content difference between arterial and mixed venous blood" are all measures of physiological parameters that are being studied in the context of the paragraph. They are not diseases.
* "Heart rate" and "cardiac output" are also physiological parameters being studied, but they are not diseases.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Hypotension |

Note:

* "Hypotension" is the only entity in the paragraph that clearly refers to a disease or medical condition.
* "SNP" is not a disease, but rather a genetic variation that may be associated with certain diseases.
* The other entities mentioned in the paragraph (pulmonary arterial pressure, central venous pressure, left ventricular end-diastolic pressure, total peripheral resistance, rate pressure product, oxygen content difference between arterial and mixed venous blood, heart rate, and cardiac output) are not diseases, but rather physiological parameters that are being studied in the context of the paragraph.
